skill.name: swarm
skill.description: Autonomous multi-agent workflow system for complex coding tasks. Use when the user requests non-trivial changes that would benefit from autonomous execution with built-in review gates. Ideal for refactoring modules, adding major features, migrating codebases, adding comprehensive test coverage, or any multi-step development task that can run autonomously. NOT for simple fixes, typos, or single-file changes.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate workflow automation skill for coordinating AI agents. The scripts execute external AI CLI tools (codex, claude) that are already installed and trusted. All capabilities align with the stated purpose. No data exfiltration, obfuscation, or unexpected network behavior detected.

content.user_title: Automate complex coding tasks with multiple agents
content.value_statement: Complex coding tasks require coordinating many steps across multiple files. This skill spawns autonomous AI agents that work through a structured plan with built-in review gates to ensure quality and catch issues early.
actual_capabilities: Interviews users to gather requirements and context
Creates structured markdown plans with checkboxes and review gates
Spawns autonomous AI agents (Claude or Codex) in iteration loops
Runs review gates (Reviewer, Simplifier, Tester, Gatekeeper) at defined intervals
Executes test commands and verifies completion criteria
Logs all agent progress in a shared plan file
limitations: Requires Claude or Codex CLI to be installed
Cannot handle tasks requiring frequent user input
Limited to 20 iterations by default (configurable via MAX_ITERATIONS)
Not suitable for exploratory or research-only tasks

use_cases.title: Refactor legacy codebases
use_cases.description: Modernize old code patterns across multiple files with automated testing and review gates.

use_cases.title: Add comprehensive tests
use_cases.description: Write test suites for existing code with proper coverage verification and review checkpoints.

use_cases.title: Migrate codebases
use_cases.description: Execute migrations (async/await, REST/GraphQL) across entire codebases with quality checks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic swarm request
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to use swarm for [describe task]. The goal is [specific measurable outcome]. Files involved: [list]. Tests: [command].

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring task
prompt_templates.prompt: Use swarm to refactor [directory/module]. Convert all callbacks to async/await. Tests must pass. Verify 80% coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Feature implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use swarm to add [feature name]. Plan file: [filename]. Tests: [command]. Review every 5 iterations.

prompt_templates.title: Code migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Use swarm to migrate [code] from [pattern A] to [pattern B]. Include linting, tests, and Gatekeeper verification.

output_examples.input: Use swarm to refactor the auth module to use async/await
output: Gatekeeper: All tests pass, creating .done file

best_practices: Define specific, measurable goals for the swarm to achieve
Include explicit test commands in the Gatekeeper checklist
Review the plan file after each iteration to catch issues early
anti_patterns: Using swarm for single-line fixes or typo corrections
Vague goals like 'improve the system' without specific outcomes
Skipping review gates to save iterations

faq.question: What AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Claude CLI and Codex CLI are supported. Use --claude or --codex flags to switch between them.

faq.question: How many iterations can the swarm run?
faq.answer: Default is 20 iterations. Override with MAX_ITERATIONS environment variable.

faq.question: How does the swarm integrate with my project?
faq.answer: The swarm reads a markdown plan file and creates a .context directory for tracking progress and completion.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only executes AI tools you have installed locally. No data is sent to external servers beyond the AI tool itself.

faq.question: What if the swarm gets stuck?
faq.answer: The swarm will stop at max iterations. Check the plan file log section to identify blockers and resume or adjust the plan.

faq.question: How is this different from regular Claude interactions?
faq.answer: Swarm runs multiple autonomous agents without waiting for user input between steps, with built-in review gates for quality.
